resources.string: Upon opening TwoSpeak, you will notice that there is a single button with a play symbol. TwoSpeak can have a single sound playback interface much like a simple parroting device or it can have multiple buttons for multiple preprogrammed responses. This setting can be changed by pressing the menu button on your phone and then selecting the settings option.
For this tutorial, select the number of buttons option and press the number 3. Next, press back to return to the main application.

Select the button you want to record by pressing the button for playback or by swiping outside the boundaries from the opposing side towards the button. For instance, to select the top right button start at the lower left corner and swipe diagonally to the upper right corner. You should see a record icon appear on the selected button.

To record, touch the left pad twice, swipe the optical sensor left, or press the menu key on your phone to access the record option. As soon as the recording dialog indicates to speak, record your ten second message. You may stop the recording at any time by pressing the phone back key, by pressing right on your keypad, or by swiping right with your optical device.
Playback any recording by simply touching the button you want to play.
